subject: Re: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: ... Sure.  Would you be willing to write it up? Mike
messageBody:
Chappell, Simon P wrote:

>
>But seriously ... while the FAQ is being updated, can we get the accessor method issue addressed the same way in the FAQ? Something along the lines of "test or don't test the accessor methods, it's your choice!" :-) Some of us like to do that and some of us don't, both view points are valid and both should be accepted/respected. But it might be good to have that explained really well in the FAQ to help the signal/noise ratio. (That being said, the signal/noise ratio around here is far in favour of signal! :-)
>

Sure. Would you be willing to write it up?

Mike
